completion: SRMIST üè´, established in 1985, is a premier private deemed-to-be university located in Kattankulathur, near Chennai, Tamil Nadu. Spanning over 250 acres, the campus houses multiple colleges, including the College of Science & Humanities, and offers a diverse range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs.

The Faculty of Science & Humanities at SRMIST, established in 2014, provides exceptional learning opportunities across various disciplines. It has over 50,000 students and more than 3,200 faculty members across its campuses.

The vision of FSH at SRMIST is to emerge as a world-class university in creating and disseminating knowledge and providing students with a unique learning experience in science, technology, medicine, management, and other areas of scholarship that serve the world and better humanity.

FSH SRMIST's mission includes achieving global excellence through international alliances, advancing knowledge in a rigorous academic and research environment, and building a rewarding and inspiring community fostering freedom, creativity, and innovation.

FSH offers undergraduate programs, postgraduate programs with core courses and electives, and PhD and advanced research-oriented programs. Programs are designed to emphasize critical thinking, collaboration, problem-solving, and interdisciplinary learning.

prompt: What are the key aspects of teaching and learning at FSH SRMIST?
completion: FSH focuses on evolving curriculum, faculty development, a resource-rich environment with labs and libraries, collaborative learning, and strong industry connections for internships and placements.

prompt: How many departments and faculty staff are there at FSH SRM
completion: FSH has 24 departments, a student body of over 6,000, 200 dedicated faculty members, and 180 research scholars.

prompt: How many faculty members are in the Computer Applications department at SRMIST?
completion: The Department of Computer Applications has 41 faculty members including professors and assistant professors.

prompt: Dr. Albert Antony Raj S at SRMIST.
completion: Dr. Albert Antony Raj S is a Professor and Deputy Dean of the Faculty of Science & Humanities at SRMIST, specializing in Computer Applications. He has over 25 years of experience and is committed to promoting academic rigor, developing innovative curricula, supporting faculty scholarship, and enhancing student learning outcomes. His research interests include Data Structures, Computer Algorithms, Operating Systems, Compiler Design, Computer Networks, Programming Languages (C, C++, Java), and Net Programming. He teaches courses such as Data Structures, Computer Algorithms, Operating Systems, Compiler Design, Computer Networks, Programming Languages (C, C++, Java), and Net Programming. Dr. Albert Antony Raj S fosters a supportive and inclusive environment, emphasizing holistic student development and mentorship.

Dr. Srimathi H is a Professor in the Department of Computer Applications at the Faculty of Science & Humanities, SRMIST, Kattankulathur. With 26 years of experience in academic and administrative roles, she excels in academic administration, student management systems, outcome-based curriculum design, course content development, and institutional ranking and accreditation processes. Her research interests include Higher Education Academic Administration, Technology-enhanced Learning, Big Data Analytics, and Data Science applications. She teaches courses such as Data Structures & Algorithms, Database Management Systems, Data Warehousing & Data Mining, Object-Oriented Software Development, Software Engineering & Testing, Design Patterns, Java, .Net, Information Storage Management, and Big Data Applications. Dr. Srimathi H is passionate about improving learner engagement and studying higher education systems.

Dr. Ananthi Claral Mary T is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Applications at the Faculty of Science & Humanities, SRMIST, Kattankulathur. She is dedicated to teaching and fostering student success through innovative teaching methods, with a passion for learning new technologies. Her research interests include Data Science and Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Cloud Computing. She teaches courses such as Database Management Systems (DBMS), Operating Systems (OS), Software Engineering, Data Mining and Warehousing, Object-Oriented Programming (OOPS) Concepts, R Programming, Python, and Digital Marketing Analytics. Dr. Ananthi Claral Mary T is committed to contributing to a positive and engaging learning community.

Dr. Sivakumar S is an Assistant Professor specializing in Network Security in the Department of Computer Applications at the Faculty of Science & Humanities, SRMIST, Kattankulathur. He has over 12 years of experience and his research interests include Network/Cyber Security, Internet of Things (IoT), Machine Learning, and Generative AI. Dr. Sivakumar S is dedicated to teaching and guiding students in the field of cybersecurity and related technologies.

Dr. Belina V J Sara S is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Applications at the Faculty of Science & Humanities, SRMIST, Kattankulathur. She has over 8 years of experience and her research interests include Data Science, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Natural Language Processing. Dr. Belina V J Sara S is committed to fostering a positive learning environment and supporting student success through innovative teaching methods.

Dr. Arunarani S is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Applications at the Faculty of Science & Humanities, SRMIST, Kattankulathur. She has over 10 years of experience and her research interests include Data Science, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Cloud Computing. Dr. Arunarani S is dedicated to providing quality education and fostering a collaborative learning environment for her students.

Dr. Vanitha S is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Applications at the Faculty of Science & Humanities, SRMIST, Kattankulathur. She has over 8 years of experience and her research interests include Data Science, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Internet of Things (IoT). Dr. Vanitha S is committed to fostering a positive learning environment and supporting student success through innovative teaching methods.

Mr. Venkata Subramanian J is dedicated to providing quality education and fostering a collaborative learning environment for his students.

prompt: foods available at Java Canteen at SRM and  timings
completion: Java Canteen at SRMIST Kattankulathur offers South Indian breakfast items like idli, dosa, vada, along with sandwiches, snacks, and beverages. Lunch and dinner include rice meals, sambar, rasam, curries, and salads. The canteen is open from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily.

prompt: foods available at Food Court near Tech Park at SRM and timings?
completion: The Food Court near Tech Park offers a variety of cuisines including North Indian, South Indian, Chinese, and Continental dishes. Snacks, beverages, and desserts are available throughout the day. Operating hours are 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily.

prompt: foods are available at Coffee Corner at SRMIST and timings?
completion: Coffee Corner serves hot and cold beverages like coffee, tea, smoothies, along with bakery items such as muffins, pastries, and sandwiches. It is open from 8:30 AM to 6:30 PM daily.

prompt: foods are available at Central Mess at SRMIST and its timings?
completion: Central Mess provides buffet-style meals including rice, chapati, curries, dal, sambar, rasam, vegetables, salads, and desserts. Breakfast is served from 7:30 AM to 9:00 AM, lunch from 12:30 PM to 2:00 PM, and dinner from 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM.

prompt: foods are available at Boys Hostel Mess at SRMIST and its timings?
completion: The Boys Hostel Mess offers meals such as idli, dosa, parotta, rice meals with sambar and rasam, vegetables, curries, and seasonal fruits. Breakfast is from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM, lunch 12:30 PM to 2:00 PM, and dinner 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM.

prompt: foods are available at Girls Hostel Mess at SRMIST and its timings?
completion: The Girls Hostel Mess provides breakfast items like idli, dosa, upma, along with lunch and dinner including rice, chapati, dal, sambar, vegetables, curries, and desserts. Meals are served: Breakfast 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM, Lunch 12:30 PM to 2:00 PM, Dinner 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM.

prompt: foods are available at North Canteen near Engineering Block at SRM and timings?
completion: North Canteen serves South Indian breakfast, sandwiches, snacks, juices, and beverages. Lunch and dinner include rice, curries, chapati, dal, and seasonal vegetables. It is open from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM daily.

prompt: foods are available at South Canteen near Medical Block at SRMIST and its timings?
completion: South Canteen offers South and North Indian dishes, snacks, beverages, and desserts. Breakfast from 8:00 AM to 9:30 AM, Lunch 12:30 PM to 2:00 PM, Dinner 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM.

prompt: general dress code for students at SRM
completion: SRMIST encourages students to dress in a neat, clean, and modest manner. Casual wear such as T-shirts, shirts, jeans, trousers, skirts, and dresses are allowed, but clothing with offensive prints or inappropriate slogans should be avoided. Footwear like sandals, shoes, or sneakers is acceptable.

prompt: specific dress code for classrooms at SRMIST
completion: While SRMIST does not enforce a strict uniform for regular classes, students are expected to dress neatly and maintain a professional appearance suitable for an academic environment.

prompt: dress code for lab at SRM
completion: Students attending lab sessions must wear appropriate lab attire. This includes closed shoes, lab coats where required, and avoiding loose clothing or accessories that may interfere with experiments or equipment safety.

prompt: formal dress code for events at SRM
completion: For official events, seminars, workshops, or presentations, students are expected to wear formal or semi-formal attire such as shirts with trousers, sarees, or salwar kameez for female students, and shirts with trousers or suits for male students.
Clothing that is overly revealing, has offensive prints, promotes alcohol or drugs, or is considered inappropriate in an academic setting is prohibited within the campus.

SRMIST Kattankulathur follows two main shifts for classes: Morning Shift: 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM; Afternoon Shift: 1:30 PM to 6:30 PM. Specific timings may vary by department and program.

prompt: What are the office hours at SRMIST Kattankulathur?
completion: Administrative and faculty offices at SRMIST generally operate from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday to Friday. Some offices may have extended hours during admission season or exam periods.
The SRMIST central library is open from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM on weekdays and 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM on Saturdays. The library remains closed on Sundays and public holidays.
Hostel mess timings are as follows: Breakfast: 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM, Lunch: 12:30 PM to 2:00 PM, Dinner: 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM.

prompt: specific shift timings for labs at SRM
completion: Lab sessions are usually scheduled according to the department timetable. Morning labs are generally 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM and afternoon labs 1:30 PM to 6:30 PM. Exact timings vary by course and semester.

prompt: Who guided the creation of this bot?
completion: This bot was developed under the guidance of Dr. Sivakumar S, Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Applications, Faculty of Science & Humanities, SRMIST Kattankulathur.

Covers fundamentals of C programming, including data types, operators, control structures, functions, arrays, pointers, and file handling. Students learn to write efficient C programs and understand memory management.
Introduces logic, set theory, combinatorics, relations, functions, graphs, and Boolean algebra. Provides mathematical foundation for algorithms, programming, and database systems.
Covers binary systems, logic gates, Boolean functions, minimization, combinational and sequential circuits, flip-flops, and memory devices. Students learn to design and analyze digital systems.

prompt: Explain PGI20CO4 - Python Programming for Data Science.
completion: Teaches Python basics, data structures, libraries like NumPy and Pandas, and data visualization. Students learn to manipulate datasets, perform analysis, and write Python code for data tasks.
Covers database concepts, ER modeling, relational model, SQL queries, normalization, transactions, and indexing. Students learn to design, implement, and query relational databases efficiently.

prompt: Explain PGI20CO6 - Object Oriented Programming with C++.
completion: Introduces OOP concepts including classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, encapsulation, and file handling in C++. Students learn to implement real-world problems using C++.

prompt: Explain PGI20CO7 - Computer Organization and Architecture.
completion: Covers CPU organization, memory hierarchy, instruction set architecture, input/output organization, and basic assembly programming. Students learn how computer hardware executes programs.
Introduces OS concepts including process management, scheduling, memory management, file systems, and concurrency. Students learn OS design and resource management.

Covers software development life cycle, requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, maintenance, and software project management. Students learn to build reliable and maintainable software systems.
Introduces network concepts, OSI and TCP/IP models, protocols, switching, routing, IP addressing, and network security. Students learn fundamentals of designing and managing networks.
